add_course module

class add_course.AddCourseForm(title: str, courses: dict[str, Course], instructors: dict[str, Instructor], callback, action_handler: ActionHandler, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Labelframe

A form for adding a new course in a Tkinter GUI.

This form allows the user to input details for a new course, including a unique course ID, course name, and instructor ID. The form validates the input, adds the course to the system, and updates the associated action handler.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – The title of the form.

  • courses (dict[str, Course]) – Dictionary of courses, keyed by course ID.

  • instructors (dict[str, Instructor]) – Dictionary of instructors, keyed by instructor ID.

  • callback (function) – A function to call once the course has been added successfully. This function refreshes all the widgets

  • action_handler (ActionHandler) – Instance of the ActionHandler to manage the addition of the course.

  • args – Additional positional arguments for the parent ttk.LabelFrame.

  • kwargs – Additional keyword arguments for the parent ttk.LabelFrame.

add_action() → Course | None[source]

Adds a new course to the system.

This method retrieves user input from the form, validates it, and adds the course to the courses dictionary and updates the instructor and the database via the ActionHandler.

Returns:

The added Course object if successful, or None if validation fails.

Return type:

Optional[Course]

validate_fields()[source]

Validates the input fields of the form.

Ensures that the course ID, course name, and instructor ID are filled out correctly, that the course ID is unique, and that the instructor ID exists.

Returns:

An empty string if all fields are valid, or an error message string detailing the issues.

Return type:

str
